metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1619 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The TLS implementation in GnuTLS before 2.12.23, 3.0.x before 3.0.28, and 3.1.x before 3.1.7 does not properly consider timing side-channel attacks on a noncompliant MAC check operation during the processing of malformed CBC padding, which allows remote attackers to conduct distinguishing attacks and plaintext-recovery attacks via statistical analysis of timing data for crafted packets, a related issue to CVE-2013-0169.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1619` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgnutls-openssl27 - 2.12.23-1ubuntu1
libgnutls26 - 2.12.23-1ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx27 - 2.12.23-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

gnutls-bin - 2.12.23-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

guile-gnutls - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls-xssl0 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutls28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
libgnutlsxx28 - 3.2.11-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> LP: #1166634 is reported as a regression

criterions.comment: gnutls26 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-1ubuntu1').
gnutls26 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.12.23-1ubuntu1').
gnutls28 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.11-2ubuntu1').
